intro: Ruellia vindex, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly rough texture. Ruellia vindex thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
